channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Leni slams proposal to rename NAIA
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Calling it “ill-timed,” Vice President Leni Robredo yesterday opposed a proposal to rename the Ninoy Aquino International Airport to Paliparang Pandaigdig ng Pilipinas.

item.title: Isko turns over 10,000 handmade masks to barangays
item.description: Manila Mayor Isko Moreno on Thursday led the turnover of 10,000 handmade washable face masks to 30 barangays in the city.

item.title: Congress to hold special session for Bayanihan 2
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Congress is set to hold a special session to pass the proposed Bayanihan to Recover as One Act, also known as Bayanihan Act 2, that will extend measures to address the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 pandemic, including the social amelioration program.

item.title: Some private schools cut fees, defer tuition hikes
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Despite additional expenses for the shift to blended or distance learning, some private schools have decided to either reduce fees or halt plans to increase tuition next school year.

item.title: COVID patients no longer infectious after 10 days – DOH
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Experts are studying if the “additional quarantine period” for recovered patients of coronavirus disease 2019 should be shortened to only seven days, the Department of Health said yesterday.

item.title: Revilla Sr., senator, film’s Agimat, 93
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Former senator Ramon Revilla Sr. died of heart failure yesterday. He was 93.

item.title: Duterte on SCS: Avoid escalating tension
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Expressing “serious concern” over recent incidents in the South China Sea, President Duterte urged yesterday fellow members of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations , particularly parties to the South China Sea dispute, to refrain from escalating tension and abide with their responsibilities under international law.

item.title: 112 areas nationwide under local lockdown
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Over a hundred areas nationwide have been placed under localized lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19, according to the Department of the Interior and Local Government.

item.title: ASEAN seeks return of business travel DOT chief sees recovery of Philippine tourism
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Resuming business travel within the Association of Southeast Asian Nations was raised by at least three ASEAN heads of state, Malacañang said, as the grouping convened yesterday for a virtual summit to map out a strategy to revive regional growth stymied by the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: UN expert raises concerns over ‘broad, overreaching’ anti-terror bill
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Fionnuala Ní Aoláin, UN special rapporteur on human rights while countering terrorism, said the proposed Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 goes “far beyond the ambit of international law and seeks to criminalize behavior and action which is in fact protected by international law.”
